verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> of Tyre. <S%H6865><s%> Howl, <S%H3213><s%> you ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish! <S%H8659><s%> For it is laid waste, <S%H7703><s%> so that there is no house, <S%H1004><s%> no entering in. <S%H935><s%> From the land <S%H776><s%> of Kittim <S%H3794><s%> it is revealed to them. <S%H1540><s%>

Be still, <S%H1826><s%> you inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the coast, <S%H339><s%> you whom the merchants <S%H5503><s%> of Sidon, <S%H6721><s%> that pass over <S%H5674><s%> the sea, <S%H3220><s%> have replenished. <S%H4390><s%>

On great <S%H7227><s%> waters, <S%H4325><s%> the seed <S%H2233><s%> of the Shihor, <S%H7883><s%> the harvest <S%H7105><s%> of the Nile, <S%H2975><s%> was her revenue. <S%H8393><s%> She was the market <S%H5505><s%> of nations. <S%H1471><s%>

Be ashamed, <S%H954><s%> Sidon; <S%H6721><s%> for the sea <S%H3220><s%> has spoken, <S%H559><s%> the stronghold <S%H4581><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "I have not travailed, <S%H2342><s%> nor brought forth, <S%H3205><s%> neither have I nourished <S%H1431><s%> young men, <S%H970><s%> nor brought up <S%H1431><s%> virgins. <S%H1330><s%>"
When the report <S%H8088><s%> comes to Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> they will be in anguish <S%H2342><s%> at the report <S%H8088><s%> of Tyre. <S%H6865><s%>
Pass over <S%H5674><s%> to Tarshish! <S%H8659><s%> Wail, <S%H3213><s%> you inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the coast! <S%H339><s%>

Is this your joyous <S%H5947><s%> city, <S%H6927><s%> whose antiquity is of ancient <S%H6924><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> whose feet <S%H7272><s%> carried <S%H2986><s%> her far away <S%H7350><s%> to travel? <S%H1481><s%>

Who has planned <S%H3289><s%> this against Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> the giver of crowns, <S%H5849><s%> whose merchants <S%H5503><s%> are princes, <S%H8269><s%> whose traffickers <S%H3667><s%> are the honorable <S%H3513><s%> of the earth? <S%H776><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies <S%H6635><s%> has planned <S%H3289><s%> it, <S%H2490><s%> to stain the pride <S%H1347><s%> of all glory, <S%H6643><s%> to bring into contempt <S%H7043><s%> all the honorable <S%H3513><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
Pass <S%H5674><s%> through your land <S%H776><s%> like the Nile, <S%H2975><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Tarshish. <S%H8659><s%> There is no restraint any more. <S%H4206><s%>

He has stretched out <S%H5186><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> over the sea. <S%H3220><s%> He has shaken <S%H7264><s%> the kingdoms. <S%H4467><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> has ordered <S%H6680><s%> the destruction <S%H8045><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%>'s strongholds. <S%H4581><s%>

He said, <S%H559><s%> "You shall rejoice <S%H5937><s%> no more, <S%H3254><s%> you oppressed <S%H6231><s%> virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Sidon. <S%H6721><s%> Arise, <S%H6965><s%> pass over <S%H5674><s%> to Kittim. <S%H3794><s%> Even there you will have no rest. <S%H5117><s%>"

Behold, <S%H776><s%> the land of the Chaldeans. <S%H3778><s%> This people <S%H5971><s%> was not. <S%H804><s%> The Assyrians founded <S%H3245><s%> it for those who dwell in the wilderness. <S%H6728><s%> They set up <S%H6965><s%> their towers. <S%H971><s%> They overthrew <S%H6209><s%> its palaces. <S%H759><s%> They made <S%H7760><s%> it a ruin. <S%H4654><s%>
Howl, <S%H3213><s%> you ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish, <S%H8659><s%> for your stronghold <S%H4581><s%> is laid waste! <S%H7703><s%>

It will come to pass in that day <S%H3117><s%> that Tyre <S%H6865><s%> will be forgotten <S%H7911><s%> seventy <S%H7657><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> according to the days <S%H3117><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> king. <S%H4428><s%> After the end <S%H7093><s%> of seventy <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> it will be to Tyre <S%H6865><s%> like in the song <S%H7892><s%> of the prostitute. <S%H2181><s%>

Take <S%H3947><s%> a harp; <S%H3658><s%> go about <S%H5437><s%> the city, <S%H5892><s%> you prostitute <S%H2181><s%> that has been forgotten. <S%H7911><s%> Make sweet <S%H3190><s%> melody. <S%H5059><s%> Sing many <S%H7235><s%> songs, <S%H7892><s%> that you may be remembered. <S%H2142><s%>

It will happen after the end <S%H7093><s%> of seventy <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> that Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> will visit <S%H6485><s%> Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> and she shall return <S%H7725><s%> to her wages, <S%H868><s%> and will play the prostitute <S%H2181><s%> with all the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> of the world <S%H776><s%> on the surface <S%H6440><s%> of the earth. <S%H127><s%>

Her merchandise <S%H5504><s%> and her wages <S%H868><s%> will be holiness <S%H6944><s%> to Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%> It will not be treasured <S%H686><s%> nor laid up; <S%H2630><s%> for her merchandise <S%H5504><s%> will be for those who dwell <S%H3427><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> sufficiently, <S%H7654><s%> and for durable <S%H6266><s%> clothing. <S%H4374><s%>
